channel.title: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically
channel.description: Hi, I installed tor browser by clicking on the icon in desktop of Whonix workstation. After it downloaded and installed tor browser, when I started it, it was in "use recommended settings"" (The first option) in "preferences" of onion button. But shouldn't "transparent proxy" get activated automatically on by whonix scripts? Thanks.

item.title: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.source: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically

item.title: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically
item.dc:creator: Grai
item.description:
Ok, just to be clear, so I should set it back to “Recommeded” settings default option (and not “transparent proxying” option)?

Read full topic
item.source: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically

item.title: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No. Whonix doesn’t modify Tor Browser. That makes a much more robust implementation and is more immune against changes by The Tor Project. Connections to 127.0.0.1:9150 are forwarded to Whonix-Gateway by rinetd. This is described here in detail:

Whonix – 3 May 20

Tor Browser Basics

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

Also using stream isolation (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation).

Read full topic
item.source: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically

item.title: [Solved] Tor Browser installer didn't set "transparent proxy" automatically
item.dc:creator: Grai
item.description:
Hi, I installed tor browser by clicking on the icon in desktop of Whonix workstation.
After it downloaded and installed tor browser, when I started it, it was in “use recommended settings”" (The first option) in “preferences” of onion button.
But shouldn’t “transparent proxy” get activated automatically on by whonix scripts?
Thanks.
